item.title: My favorite python
item.description: Using the library reticulate, we can have both R chunks and python chunks within the same file! Isnâ€™t that neat library(reticulate) hi<-"Hello" hi="world" print(r.hi, hi) ## ('Hello', 'world') cat(c(hi,py$hi)) ## Hello world Some other things I have done in Python involve creating simple functions with strings. The code below takes a string of nucleotides and uses them as the input and returns all the 3-mers present, and the number of times that each 3-mer occured with the dictionary function.
